intro: Psephellus recepii, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sun-exposed areas. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat head. Psephellus recepii is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine.
